meanings.definition: A small piece or fragment of something
meanings.sent1: I found a tiny scrap of paper on the floor.
meanings.sent2: She collected every scrap of fabric to make a quilt.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the scrap of yarn, thinking it was a mouse.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like scattered scraps of paper, waiting to be put together.
meanings.sent5: The old book was falling apart, with every scrap of page yellowed and fragile.

meanings.definition: Discard or dispose of as no longer useful or desirable
meanings.sent1: Please scrap the broken toy and get a new one.
meanings.sent2: They decided to scrap the old car and buy a new one.
meanings.sent3: He tried to scrap the idea of going out, but his friends convinced him otherwise.
meanings.sent4: She had to scrap her original plan and come up with a new one at the last minute.
meanings.sent5: The company had to scrap the project due to budget constraints.

meanings.definition: A fight or quarrel, especially a minor one
meanings.sent1: There was a scrap between the two kids over a toy.
meanings.sent2: The siblings often had scraps over who got to use the computer first.
meanings.sent3: The playful scrap between the puppies turned into a chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The scrap between the neighbors was quickly resolved with an apology.
meanings.sent5: The small scrap between the students was settled by the teacher before it escalated.
